content: join is called join as you go 2008 copperscaledragon page 3 of 5 published <date> c o p p e r s c a l e d r a g o n - < p a t t e r n n a m e > another possible join for this is into the valley made where the sections come together this will give a totally different look to your pattern here you can see the completed piece with both joins there are many others you may use i am just giving you these to get you started 2008 copperscaledragon page 4 of 5 published <date> c o p p e r s c a l e d r a g o n - < p a t t e r n n a m e > i am working on a shawl using the join at the points and working the starting circle and joining it to the 4th single_crochet on the chain 5 space of the triangle i am joining to it is worked like this chain 4 11 double_crochet in 4th chain from the hook join to top of chain 4 to form a circle chain 1 place into space between 3 triangles where you want to join i worked flat my footstool for this work slip_stitch into 4 single_crochet from point of the triangle arm you are working on chain 1 skip 1 slip_stitch in next st repeat this around you should have something resembling a 6 pointed star helpful links you might use free crochet video tutorials http //www nexstitch com/tutorials html tips techniques abbreviations etc http //www baycrochet com/tech htm abbreviations chart symbols stitch guide http //www geocities com/heartland/cottage/3606/tutorialpage html ©copperscaledragon 2008 copperscaledragon@yahoo com if you need help there is more information on my blog http //copperscaledragon blogspot com/ ravelry user name copperscaledrago 2008 copperscaledragon page 5 of 5 published <date>
